page.title: 15VICTORIA FLATS DEVELOPMENT
page.content: Between 1968 and 1970,503 flats were built consisting of five blocks of deck access type housing. Present conversion work will result in 520 flats.Previously terraced cottages stood on the site on streets named Blagg,Waterloo,Dicken,York,Fence,Arbou rhay & Daybrook.Some of these names have been incorporated into the new development,e.g.York Court,Arbourhay. A small parental survey showed: Advantages:Close proximity to town,bus & railway stations,supermarket & Victoria Park. Disadvantages:Difficult & costly to heat (all electric) draughty,noisy,no private section out- side door.Lifts often dirty,dog dirt on walkways,no back door or garden. Place of Work; 46.15% in Macclesfield 15.38% out of Macc. 25.64%unemployed 12.83%unknown. 12.82% one parent families.
